voicesplitting.voice

Class SingleNoteVoice

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.voice.Voice
      • voicesplitting.voice.SingleNoteVoice

  • public class SingleNoteVoice
extends Voice
    A SingleNoteVoice is a Voice which can only contain a single MidiNote at a time.

    This is the Voice class used in the paper submitted to ISMIR 2015.

    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 6 April, 2015

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • lastNoteNode

        private SingleNoteVoiceNode lastNoteNode
        A node with the last note in this Voice. These are backwards-linked so we can get the entire List of notes from this node.

      • params

        private VoiceSplittingParameters params
        The parameters to use when splitting into voices.

        public double getProbability(MidiNote note)
        Get the probability score of adding the given note to this Voice.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • pitchScore

        private double pitchScore(double weightedPitch,
                int pitch2)
        Get the pitch closeness of the two given pitches. This value should be higher the closer together the two pitch values are. The first input parameter is a double because it is drawn from getWeightedLastPitch().
        Parameters:
        weightedPitch - A weighted pitch, drawn from getWeightedLastPitch().
        pitch2 - An exact pitch.
        Returns:
        The pitch score of the given two pitches, a value between 0 and 1.

      • gapScore

        private double gapScore(long time1,
              long time2)
        Get the pitch closeness of the two given pitches. This value should be higher the closer together the two pitch values are.
        Parameters:
        time1 - A time.
        time2 - Another time.
        Returns:
        The gap score of the two given time values, a value between 0 and 1.

      • canAddNoteAtTime

        public boolean canAddNoteAtTime(long time,
                       long length)
        Description copied from class: Voice
        Decide if a new note of the given length can be added at the given time.
        Specified by:
        canAddNoteAtTime in class Voice
        Parameters:
        time - The time we wish to check.
        length - The length of the note we want to add.
        Returns:
        True if we can add a note of the given length at the given time. False otherwise.

      • getLastOffsetTime

        public long getLastOffsetTime()
        Description copied from class: Voice
        Get the last offset time of any note in this Voice.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getLastNote

        public MidiNote getLastNote()
        Description copied from class: Voice
        Get the MidiNote in this Voice with the most recent onset time.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The MidiNote from this Voice with the last onset time.

      • getWeightedLastPitch

        public double getWeightedLastPitch()
        Description copied from class: Voice
        Get the weighted last pitch of this Voice. That is, the most recent pitch of this Voice, looking back VoiceSplittingParameters.PITCH_HISTORY_LENGTH notes, and weighting each one less the further back we look.
        Specified by:
        getWeightedLastPitch in class Voice
        Returns:
        A weighted average of the average pitches of the last VoiceSplittingParameters.PITCH_HISTORY_LENGTH notes or chords, weighing more recent notes or chords higher, or 0 if we have none yet.

      • getNumNotes

        public int getNumNotes()
        Description copied from class: Voice
        Get the number of notes total in this Voice.
        Specified by:
        getNumNotes in class Voice
        Returns:
        The number of notes in this Voice.

      • getNumNotesCorrect

        public int getNumNotesCorrect()
        Description copied from class: Voice
        Get the number of notes in this Voice which have been assigned to the correct Voice. That is the number which belong to the midi track from which the majority of the notes in this Voice come.
        Specified by:
        getNumNotesCorrect in class Voice
        Returns:
        The number of notes which have been classified to this Voice correctly.

      • getNumLinksCorrect

        public int getNumLinksCorrect(java.util.List<java.util.List<MidiNote>> goldStandard)
        Get the number of links in this Voice which are correct. That is, the number of times that two consecutive notes belong to the same midi track.
        Parameters:
        goldStandard - The gold standard voices for this song.
        Returns:
        The number of times that two consecutive notes belong to the same midi track.
